result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W Klahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Paid in full from bond posted. Remaining bond returned to poster.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
  Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
  Defendant to submit to random testing.
Submit to DNA sample by 1/30/16

Defendant Joseph W Klahn appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody.  Court advises of the penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  Court examines defendant on right to counsel.  Defendant indicates will be retaining private counsel.  State requesting $500 cash bail w/conditions.  Corporal Gahan advises there is a probation hold at this time.  Court finds good cause to extend timelimits for holding of the prelim to allow def time to retain counsel.  Status hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
